title: What DAOs Can Learn from Rainbow — 50yrs of Decentralized Autonomous Gathering
body:
## The Immense Potential of DAOs

For an in-depth yet beginner friendly introduction to DAOs, please check out [this NYTimes article](https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2022/03/18/technology/what-are-daos.html).

Historically, centralized power seemed to have obviously ‘won’ against the decentralized crowd —— we have witnessed how local faiths overpowered by organized religions, co-ops outcompeted by conglomerates, indigenous tribes eliminated by empires. We live in a world where profit incentives aren’t aligned with the common wealth and resources are shamefully extracted to maximize profit for individual gains.

Without doubt, technologies are best used to serve humanity’s overall well-being. Blockchain solutions can be used to realign our incentives, create equitable and transparent systems to avoid corruption and exploitation. The DAO space has huge potential to create **community-oriented autonomous templates to fundamentally decentralize the way humans operate** in order to **create abundance for all.**

![Homemade meme about DAOs](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/TrgE2iuoFa1Fvi7OIiyOx.png?height=1011&width=1166)

Within a system that is transparent and fair, people would operate better because they ‘can’t do bad’ instead of ‘won’t do bad’. The Gitcoin’s theory on [ImpactDAOs](https://store.gitcoin.co/products/impactdao-book-digital-edition) did a deep dive into this philosophy.

It is worth noting that DAOs are still in its infancy, most DAOs are in its process of figuring out the best suited ways to govern. Many DAOs have very long and redundant execution processes as a protection against centralized dictatorship which often led to inefficiency and bureaucracy. Being born at the heart of the crypto industry, DAOs can be filled with pyramid scams and inflated values.

Because of the immaturity and capital-infested nature of crypto, learnings on the art of gathering and coordination may best come from outside of the DAO space. Humans have been organizing in swift and ingenue ways centuries before blockchain technology appeared.

DAOs are schelling points for strangers to gather around a shared mission & vision and collectively accumulate resources to achieve this shared goal. —— This is exactly what [Rainbow Gathering](https://rainbowfamilygatherings.net/) has achieved in the past 50 years without blockchain.

## What is the Rainbow Gathering?

![Pic from SDBP Radio](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/NHzQChJZjYJaW7Pb2-dou.png?height=542&width=880)

*Special Thanks to [@mycobici](https://twitter.com/mycobici) for encouraging me to go to the 50 years Rainbow Gathering and drawing the analogy between Rainbow and DAOs. Special Thanks to [@imu](https://www.instagram.com/zenthebus/) for sending me courage, love and the Rainbow Gathering coordinate. 💕*

I heard about the rainbow gathering from an off-grid eco village at the southern tip of Hilo, Hawaii.

“It’s a gathering about peace, love and generosity. It is completely free to go and everything was shared in a gift-based society”, said someone from the eco village, who at the time refuses to have a cellphone or wear shoes.

“There is no tickets, no social media. Location changes every year mostly in different national forests and the only way to find out is through word of mouth.

The gatherings also happen all around the world. Europe, the Middle East, Asia, Costa Rica, Mexico… and here on the Big Island! The main gathering is in the US every year, the main international gathering rotates around the world, and there are regionals happening all the time.”

Rainbow Gathering started in 1972, it is [defined](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rainbow_Gathering) as a gathering where people ‘congregate in remote forests around the world for one or more weeks at a time with the stated intention of living a shared ideology of peace, harmony, freedom, and respect.’

The first gathering happened in Colorado where twenty thousand people faced police roadblocks, threatened [civil disobedience](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Civil_disobedience), and were allowed onto [National Forest](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_National_Forest) land. It has spontaneously become a yearly tradition ever since.

In this anti-capitalist and anti-materialist world, people put up temporary cabins and tents, campfires and water filters, shared everything in a mutually respectful way. Regardless of cultural background or race, people shared a common language that is peace and love.

![Pic of Rainbow from Sky-Hi News](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/z2Savl-0dyYT_81p5EB0F.png?height=637&width=1024)

It is worth iterating that there are natural problems that come with the gathering, I do not wish to say that everything happens with the Rainbow community is always positive. The concerns about Rainbow Gathering will be claimed in the section in the end.

## How Decentralized?

The gathering has no single leader, no corporation and usually no money involved except for some donations. All organizers gather and find common grounds cooperatively. Anyone that felt the urge to contribute can volunteer to organize since helping hands are always needed.

At each gathering, organizers would arrive weeks in advance to pave roads, study the terrain and plan out the locations. Different kitchen crews would put up camps with cookware, shelves, washing stations, toilet holes and sometimes showers. Individuals usually gather around the kitchens, enjoy the meals and help out when they can.

![Reverse Osmosis Connected to River Water](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/By8WYji7f2M2sDBxgsCII.jpg?height=716&width=1000)

Each camp has its own culture and quite unique characteristics. In the 50yr’s gathering in Colorado, **Instant Soup** served vegan soup 24/7 and always had elderly folks singing around campfire every night. **Wanna Burn** was a kitchen organized by nomad performers and fire spinners and they just felt like lovely pirates. I was told by the crew if anyone took out a cellphone at the kitchen it would get smashed. **Kids Village** as the name suggested were a fun space for kids to run around with small bridges and swings.

![Pic from Atlas Obscura](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/kqlMdmqaYgMyuQv4guELZ.png?height=2474&width=3235)

Each kitchen dug its ‘compost’ holes for organic matters and buried them after they’re full. ‘Shitters’ were dug at various locations and ashes and dirt were put on them to avoid flies and diseases. All non-organic trash were carried out by volunteers as people started to leave. Crates from recycle companies were placed at the entrance of the gathering.

At the center you can find **Info Camp** where all info and activities can be found on bulletin boards, medical tents where student volunteers treated the sick and injured.

![Map about the 2022 Gathering in Colorado](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/z-ids5g5ZGXDsci0ACZ1q.png?height=1097&width=843)

During the gathering, various events were celebrated and projects were made. On July 4th, everyone gathered in the main lawn and prayed in silence for world peace. People put together sweat lodges, had meetings about permaculture and eco villages. There was yoga and Tai-chi practices, poetry nights, music circles, fire dancing… Basically, if enough people want to make something happen, it would happen.

## Unanimous Consensus

![Rainbow Family Pic from Wikipedia](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/PWXQIX4NRhW0hSyHjU62x.jpg?height=900&width=1200)

The most important decision every gathering is where to have Rainbow next year. This decision is made by the ‘Vision Circle’ which is usually held at the end of each gathering. Anyone who shows up at the Vision Circle would may speak and hold voting power regardless of their expertise. Unanimous consensus is required for any decisions to be made, the Vision Circle sometimes take days to complete in order to reach consensus.

I sat at the Vision Circle for hours just to observe the process, it reminds me of filibustering in politics. Although the difference is that anyone who wanted to speak can speak, and there is absolutely no interruption to anyone’s speech.

Majority of people do not feel the need to participate in this decision making process. Since the location rotates every year across the US, it seems like a natural flow of evenly distributed choices.

I do believe Vision Circle exists more for the spirit of making sure everyone’s voice is heard. **The nature of unanimous consensus symbolizes that individual satisfaction is less important than group cohesion and harmony, which in itself is a quite beautiful spirit for any organization.** There will always be someone dissatisfied in the end, but everyone still celebrates when a decision was made.

## How Autonomous?

The idea of Rainbow got brought to different corners of the world by people attended the first few gatherings. It has shown that decentralized social movements can be ‘templatized’. Once the formula has been play-tested, it can be ‘forked’ to different places and adopted to its local culture.

**The formula is intuitive and the message is simple and powerful.**

Just like how [Maslow summarized universal structure of basic human needs](https://www.simplypsychology.org/maslow.html#:\~:text=From%20the%20bottom%20of%20the,attend%20to%20needs%20higher%20up.), Rainbow summarized universal solutions about gathering in the forest.

Basic survival practices such as: choosing location with the right climate and source of water, setting up kitchen with chopped wood, preparing filters for river water, digging ‘shitters’ and burying feces with ashes and soil so diseases don’t spread, having event calendar visible in central info station, having safe words and other codes of conducts… All these formula are simple enough to be put into a handbook that can be carried cross boarder and language and learned quite intuitively, most of them might already be known by experienced outdoor survivors.

Just a good formula is not enough without a strong motivation to gather of course. Getting a group of unmotivated people to do things is harder than making pigs fly. For Rainbow, the motive to gather comes is simple and powerful, it is that **everybody is welcome in this gift-based society of love and peace** —— a message quite hard to say no to.

As long as people feel the need to gather, people would find ways to do so. The gathering is very much an organic and natural formation. Nothing is forced, nothing is paid for, nothing is for show, nothing is for sale. People gathered and united around a common mission in a completely authentic and compassionate way.

Just like how songs and stories spread across continents way before the birth of telegraph or internet, just like a good meme, penetrating through firewalls and cultural differences, whenever an art form or a message resonates with people deeply and fundamentally, it will flow effortlessly for as far as it can.

## The Giving Culture as a Schelling Point

Many would say Rainbow is a counter culture movement, it is everything ‘default society’ is not. The Rainbow culture is simple enough to spread far across cultures and borders, yet profound enough to create amazing impact on individuals.

It’s quite fascinating to have hiked miles into deep forest to be offered massages and served organic vegan soup for as many times as you want, none of which cost anything.

We talk about ‘flipping the game theory’ and ‘incentive alignment’ a lot in the DAO space, and the folks at Rainbow did it in such a simple way ---- a demographic that supposedly has little wealth proved that achieving abundance with very little is possible. It really does make you rethink about post scarcity differently. Even thou it might not be long term sustainable and comes with its own set of problems, there are still things we can learn from.

Paradigm shift need to come from mental shift, or as the new age hippies would call it: a consciousness shift. I do believe that with any emerging communication or governance technology, **the cultural spirit would be at the center of any social movement.** There would be no social change without a mentality shift free of existing construct of exploitations and unhealthy competitions.

## Conclusion

Just like a knife can be used to cut butter or to kill people, the technology can be misused if it wasn’t intentional. Just because DAOs share the same technology doesn’t mean they share the same principle of operations. DAOs can be ‘central banks’, they can be outright valueless scams, or continued exploitations with cycles of pump and dump.

**We aim to create systems where people ‘can’t act bad’, but it’s also crucial to create a culture where people ‘don’t want to act bad’. These two aspects, the spirit and the form, should be treated with equal importance in order to co-create something beautiful. That’s when DAOs meet Rainbow.**

DAOs are by nature community oriented, and the community would seed the culture of the DAO. I believe [DAOs have potential to change how we coordinate and operate in many ways](https://blog.aragon.org/10-industries-being-disrupted-by-daos/), with a precondition that their shared mission is **simple and clearly defined, with authentic passion adhering to one’s intrinsic value**, and hopefully, oriented towards creating better future for all living beings. ❤️

## Disclaimer —— Warnings About Rainbow ⚠️

Without over glorifying Rainbow, it’s important to mention the negative aspects of its culture.

Because everyone is welcomed, there is no guarantee that everybody at the gathering will behave in a mutually respectful way. Because it is free, there is a natural influx of people who live on the streets without homes. Because of its emphasis on personal freedom, there is always an abundance of illegal drugs.

Because of the anti-capitalistic mentality as its spirit, many people choose to be **anti-productivity** as well. Lots of people choose not to work or do anything constructive, and it became a gateway to indulgence in hedonism and anti-accomplishment mentality. The press and rumors about Rainbow are also mostly negative for all these reasons.

**Here’s my observation at the gathering:**

Going to the gathering by myself for the first time, I was unsure of what to expect and was on high alert, very soon I relaxed and felt right at home. I’ve had many fun conversations with various characters of all ages and cultural backgrounds, gypsy flow artists from Europe, qi-gong masters from China, energy healers from Israel, farmers from Iowa, intentional village organizers from Tennessee, nomads from Bosnia, musicians from Turkey… It was a fun and diverse group of people, I felt accepted, respected and most of the time enjoyed everyone’s company.

There was an abundance of psychedelic drugs and weed being shared at the gathering. Most of them given out for free to people who ask for them. Occasionally you would see people tripping hard and acting ‘over the top’, however, comparing to a regular music festival, I would say it actually has a lot less of non-sober people — which was a total surprise for me.

Rainbow was a lot more family oriented compare to regular music festivals. There were many kids and elderly, many people I met brought their parents. Preparing and sharing group meals and singing in music circles were the majority of the activities. I would personally bring my parents to a Rainbow Gathering but probably not Burning Man.

The only ‘iffy thing’ that I observed was when someone looked like in high adrenaline said another ‘crazy’ person was trying to attack him and he dodged away. It did remind me that this was an event that everyone is welcome and everything is allowed so we do have to be cautious.

Although it might be inevitable to have zero trash and disturbance to the environment given the scale of the gathering, I do think the organizers and volunteers did their best to protect local environment, they would spend weeks cleaning up everything after everyone leaves, ‘putting rocks back where they’re supposed to be’, said Scottie, an Urban designer from Yale who’s been organizing Rainbow for decades, ’The location was strategically chosen to be far away from river sources to protect the local water’s ecosystem.’ Everyone was also informed to only use dead trees for campfire wood and structure building.

## More Conclusions!

In the end I want to say that this post is not suggesting that if everyone becomes hippies and gather in the woods we would solve all world’s problems, nor that Rainbow is an absolute golden formula for DAOs to learn from.

The Rainbow Gathering is a formula that worked for decades, with a simple and beautiful message. It exists because it needs to exist and it will continue to exist as long as enough people make it happen, it will always be at the cross of the supply and demand curve, and the longer it goes, the more experienced it would be at decentralized autonomous gathering.

After hearing many negative comments and press about Rainbow I was glad to experience it myself and make my own distinction. I’m eternally grateful that something simple and beautiful can be experienced with no barrier of entry, and see people take care of each other with so much generosity and unconditional love. I have restored some faith in humanity, and felt encouraged to pursuit what I’m called to do ---- using technology to serve the holistic well being of humans and create abundance for all. 🌈

![Rainbow Gathering 2022, Main Circle](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/xPa-dPjMhfUoe_xtWE0I5.jpg?height=602&width=1200)

title: Sunscreen 筹集了 465 万美元用于构建新网络的隐私引擎
body:
我们很高兴推出 Sunscreen，开源我们的全同态加密编译器，并启动我们的赠款计划！

[全同态加密](https://blog.sunscreen.tech/an-intro-to-fully-homomorphic-encryption-for-engineers/)(FHE) 是下一代公钥加密技术，允许任何人*直接*对加密数据执行任意计算。尽管 FHE 有可能为新应用程序和新用户带来隐私，但该技术对于开发人员来说早已遥不可及。最初，FHE 面临的挑战是效率（即没有效率）。在过去的几年里，主要的障碍是可用性。这项技术对于非专家来说太难使用了。

我们在 Sunscreen 的目标是让工程师可以使用高级隐私技术（如 FHE），以便他们可以轻松构建和部署私有应用程序。

Sunscreen 的想法最初是在我担任 NuCypher 的密码学家时提出的，当时我正在[研究](https://eprint.iacr.org/2021/727)保护隐私的智能合约。到目前为止，零知识证明一直主导着 web3 的隐私叙述，但在 Sunscreen，我们相信故事还有更多。

我们的 465 万美元种子轮融资由 Polychain Capital 牵头，Northzone、Coinbase Ventures、dao5 和 Naval Ravikant 参与，随后获得了 57 万美元的小额种子轮融资。我很高兴与大家分享，我的一些前 NuCypher 同事将成为 Sunscreen 的顾问（[MacLane](https://twitter.com/maclanewilkison)、[Ghada](https://ghadaalmashaqbeh.github.io/)）或天使投资人（[Michael](https://twitter.com/newmichwill?lang=en)、[Tux](https://twitter.com/__tux)）的一部分。

## 开源我们的 FHE 编译器

尽管 FHE 很神奇，但实际上编写 FHE 程序非常困难。研究人员创建了“编译器”来简化这个过程，但到目前为止还不够。现有的 FHE 编译器通常难以使​​用或引入显着的性能损失。

在过去的几个月里，我们一直在开发自己的 FHE 编译器，今天我们将开源。随意查看[我们的图书馆](https://github.com/Sunscreen-tech/Sunscreen)！如果您想在安装我们的编译器之前尝试编写一些代码，我们还有一个可用的[游乐场。](https://playground.sunscreen.tech/)

Web3 开发人员有[独特的挑战和担忧](https://docs.sunscreen.tech/compiler/who.html)；我们是第一个设计具有这种需求的 FHE 编译器的人。然而，这只是我们在 web3 中实现私有计算的全部承诺的第一步。

## 启动我们的 FHE 资助计划

我们还启动了一项赠款计划，以促进对 FHE 的进一步研究和开发。我们希望鼓励开发人员构建私有应用程序并教社区中的其他人如何这样做。

查看我们的[私人代币交换](https://docs.sunscreen.tech/fhe_programs/example.html)和[私人信息检索](https://docs.sunscreen.tech/fhe_programs/pir_intro.html)示例，了解 FHE 已经走了多远。在笔记本电脑上不到 1 秒，您就可以生成 FHE 密钥、加密数据、在加密数据上运行程序*以及*解密结果！

[您可以在此处](https://blog.sunscreen.tech/p/8be90347-1a0f-4371-8b9d-449bb1f943fc/)阅读有关我们的资助计划的更多信息。

## 展望未来

那么防晒霜的下一步是什么？我们将致力于支持开发人员构建私有应用程序所需的基础设施。具体来说，我们将专注于与互补的零知识证明库以及去中心化存储解决方案的集成。

如果您觉得这听起来令人兴奋，请通过 hello@sunscreen.tech 与我们联系！[我们正在招聘](https://www.notion.so/Jobs-at-Sunscreen-6966db120ec3425ead92f64b40d4cb17)多个职位。

您还可以加入我们的[Discord 社区](https://discord.gg/sunscreen)或在[Twitter 上](https://twitter.com/SunscreenTech)关注我们以获取公告。

（声明：如果中文翻译与英文原文有歧义之处，请以英文原文为准。如小伙伴们发现翻译表达有误，也请及时指正。有些文字不采用中文翻译而保留了英文，是为了统一术语，减少歧义。）

title: 宣布我们的 FHE 赠款计划
body:
# Sunscreen 正在启动一项赠款计划，以鼓励进一步研究和开发完全同态加密 (FHE)。

我们很高兴让开发人员考虑如何使用 FHE 构建私有应用程序。我们还旨在促进对 FHE 的更广泛研究（尤其是在 web3 的背景下）；因此，我们提供各种赠款来推进我们的两个目标。

一旦与互补的零知识证明库的集成完成，我们计划启动一个更大的赠款计划。FHE 与零知识证明相结合，将为 web3 带来令人兴奋的新用例。

###      资助类别

我们的赠款计划有 4 个主要类别——演练、新应用程序、部署/集成和密码学。我们已经为每个类别提供了建议金额，但如果您的提案特别涉及或复杂，我们可以提供更高的金额。选定的贡献将提供给整个社区。

不要觉得我们这里有什么限制！如果您的想法不太适合这些类别之一，我们很乐意听取您的意见。

**类别                                                                                                                 建议金额**                                      演练                                                                                         100 - 500 美元                        适用于 web2 或 web3 的新应用                                               $500 - $5000                                            部署和集成                                                                                $1000 - $50,000                        密码学                                                                          $1000 - $100,000给我们惊喜！？？？

### 演练

使用 Sunscreen 的 FHE 编译器提供您自己的简单 FHE 程序的演练，或演示我们编译器的有趣功能。对于前者，请查看我们的[私人信息检索](https://docs.sunscreen.tech/fhe_programs/pir_intro.html)和[私人令牌交换](https://docs.sunscreen.tech/fhe_programs/example.html)演练。一些额外的建议是：

* 将 FHE 程序链接在一起（以便将一个 FHE 程序的输出用作另一个 FHE 程序的输入）
* 演示如何更改[明文模数](https://docs.sunscreen.tech/advanced/plain_modulus/plain_modulus.html)和/或噪声容限以获得更好的性能
* [分数和有理数](https://docs.sunscreen.tech/fhe_programs/types/types.html)的乐趣

### 新应用

创建您自己的 web2 或 web3 应用程序，利用 Sunscreen 的 FHE 编译器提供数据隐私。一些建议是：

* 私人数据分析或私人推理（例如保护隐私的机器学习应用程序）
* 私有数据库查找
* 有隐私的游戏
* 身份管理
* 浏览器中的应用程序/针对 WASM
* 线性代数相关应用

### 部署和集成

我们很高兴在 web3 应用程序中支持 FHE。但是，这样做需要额外的研发。此类别的一些建议包括：

* 创建绑定
* 调查 BFV 方案（和/或 Sunscreen 的编译器）与 Ethereum、Cosmos、Polkadot、Solana、Avalanche 等的兼容性。

### 密码学

这个类别相当广泛。在工程方面，我们对 BFV 方案/Sunscreen 编译器的改进以及与高效 ZKP 库的集成特别感兴趣。在研究方面，我们有兴趣进一步研究与 BFV 方案兼容的高效 ZKP 结构。

一些建议是：

* 研究与 BFV 方案兼容的高效 ZKP 结构
* 多密钥BFV方案研发
* 为 Sunscreen 的 FHE 编译器进行 ZKP 库集成
* 致力于进一步的编译器优化
* 将编译器支持扩展到 CKKS 方案
* 添加对引导的支持（用于[SEAL](https://github.com/microsoft/SEAL)的 BFV 方案的实施）
* 添加对同态比较的支持（用于[SEAL](https://github.com/microsoft/SEAL)的 BFV 方案的实现）
* 针对其他 FHE 编译器进行[更广泛的基准测试](https://docs.sunscreen.tech/compiler/performance.html)

  ### 如何申请

  该程序的应用程序可[在此处](https://sunscreen.typeform.com/fhegrants)获得。

  我们的目标是在提交后 2 周内审核申请。如果我们认为这很合适，我们将安排电话会议更详细地讨论您的提案。

  如果您有任何问题或需要集思广益的帮助，请随时在[Discord](https://discord.gg/sunscreen)上与我们聊天！
* （声明：如果中文翻译与英文原文有歧义之处，请以英文原文为准。如小伙伴们发现翻译表达有误，也请及时指正。有些文字不采用中文翻译而保留了英文，是为了统一术语，减少歧义。）

title: 工程师全同态加密简介
body:
### 全同态加密 (FHE) 是一种传说中的技术，它允许对加密数据进行任意计算。由于隐私是整个技术的主要关注点，FHE 完美地融入了这种新的叙述，并且与从公共分布式账本到机器学习的不同领域相关。

全同态加密是一种传说中的技术（至少在密码学界），它允许对加密数据进行任意计算。由于隐私是整个技术的主要关注点，完全同态加密 (FHE) 完全适合这种新的叙述。FHE 与公共分布式账本（如区块链）和机器学习相关。

第一个 FHE 计划于 2009 年由 Craig Gentry 成功构建。从那时起，已经提出了许多 FHE 方案，并且在该领域没有缺乏相关工作。但是，对于为什么要完成所有这些工作或其中任何工作的动机，几乎没有解释。刚开始学习 FHE 时，我有很多疑问：为什么会有这么多方案？FHE 有实际用例吗？如果 FHE 像描述的那样强大，为什么它还没有起飞？

我们将首先介绍 FHE 的工作原理以及它可能有用的一些领域。文章的重点在第 2 部分，我们在其中考虑了为什么FHE 尚未受到广泛关注以及这些问题的一些潜在解决方案。TL; DR 是目前使用 FHE 库时完全缺乏可用性。FHE 方案的所有内部工作原理和复杂性（其中有很多）都暴露给工程师。

最后，如果您有兴趣亲自动手，我们将指向该领域的一些库。

### 什么是全同态加密（FHE）？

全同态加密是一种加密方案，允许您对加密数据执行任意\*计算。

* 不完全正确，但我们暂时将其排除在外

### 公钥加密方案的复习

让我们从加密方案的简要回顾开始。明文是明文数据（即未加密数据），而密文是加密数据。

加密方案中的算法
加密方案包括以下 3 种算法：

**1**  KeyGen(...security_parameters)→ keys：密钥生成算法将一些安全参数作为其输入。然后它输出方案的密钥。

**2** Encrypt(plaintext, key, randomness)→ ciphertext：加密算法将明文、密钥和一些随机性（加密必须是概率性的才能“安全”）作为输入。然后输出相应的密文（即加密数据）。

**3** Decrypt(ciphertext, key)→ plaintext：解密算法将密文和密钥作为输入。它输出相应的明文。

在私钥加密方案中，同样key用于加密和解密。这意味着任何可以加密明文（即明文数据）的人也可以解密密文（即加密数据）。这些类型的加密方案也被称为“对称”，因为加密/解密之间的关系是对称的。

然而，在公钥加密方案中，不同的密钥用于加密和解密。个人可能能够加密数据，但无法解密相应的密文。这些类型的加密方案也被称为“非对称”，因为加密/解密之间的关系是非对称的。

您之前可能听说过 [ElGamal 加密方案]() （它基于[Diffie-Hellman 密钥交换](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Diffie%E2%80%93Hellman_key_exchange)）。这些方案通常在介绍性密码学课程中教授，并且（在大多数现代应用中）依赖于一种常用的密码学类型，称为[椭圆曲线密码学](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Elliptic-curve_cryptography)。

### 那么“同态”部分是什么意思呢？

我们将把重点转向同态（公钥）加密方案，因为它们是最有用的。“同态”部分意味着在明文空间（即所有有效的明文）与密文空间（即所有有效的密文）中执行计算之间存在特殊关系。

具体来说，在“同态加密方案”中，以下关系成立：

同态加法：Encrypt(a) + Encrypt(b) = Encrypt(a + b)
同态乘法：Encrypt(a) \* Encrypt(b) = Encrypt(a \* b)
允许您执行以下操作：
Encrypt(3xy + x) = Encrypt(3xy) + Encrypt(x) = \[3 \* Encrypt(x) \* Encrypt(y)\] + Encrypt(x)

所以只要知道Encrypt(x)和Encrypt(y)，我们就可以计算更复杂的多项式表达式的加密。

### 它是如何工作的？直觉是什么？

简称Encrypt(a)为a'。简称Encrypt(b)为b'。回想一下a'和b'是密文。

每次我们执行同态操作时，我们都会在密文中添加额外的噪声。在某些时候，如果噪声太大，您将无法成功解密密文。你只是运气不好。对于同态加法，噪声不会增长得太厉害。您可以将噪声增长视为Noise(a' + b') = Noise(a') + Noise(b')。然而，问题在于执行同态乘法。在同态乘法中，噪声增长表现为Noise(a' \* b') = Noise(a') \* Noise(b')。

让我们用一些数字来使这更具体。我们会说Noise(a')是 10。我们会说Noise(b')是 20。FHE 方案有一些噪声上限，在此之后我们无法解密密文，即使我们有解密密钥。对于我们的示例，假设噪声上限为 300。在两个密文之间执行一次同态加法后，噪声将为10 + 20 = 30。不错！a'但是，如果我们在和之间执行单个同态乘法b'，则生成的噪声将10 \* 20 = 200针对密文a' \* b'。如果我们然后尝试计算(a' \* b') \* (a')，对于 FHE 方案来说，噪声将太大！(a' \* b') \* (a')因此，即使我们有解密密钥（因为Noise(a' \* b') \* Noise(a') = 200 \* 10 = 2000），我们也无法解密。

正确设置方案的所有参数，在正确的时间执行“噪声控制”操作是您的工作（我们不会在本文中讨论这些操作是什么，因为它们可能因方案而异），并且尽量不要这样做许多同态乘法。这听起来让你感到害怕吗？那你的陪伴很好。

注意：有一种方法可以绕过固定的噪声上限——“[自举](https://crypto.stanford.edu/craig/easy-fhe.pdf)”——它具有自己的一套复杂性和权衡取舍。

### 构建完全同态加密方案需要什么？

所有 FHE 方案都使用一种特定类型的[后量子密码术](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Post-quantum_cryptography)，称为[格密码术](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lattice-based_cryptography)。好消息是 FHE 可以抵抗来自量子计算机的攻击（如果我们应该关注这样的事情是完全不同的话题）。坏消息是，即使您以前参加过密码学入门课程，您也可能不熟悉格密码学。

简单地说，晶格位于实向量空间（也称为 R^n）内，可以使用向量和矩阵表示（您绝对应该熟悉！）。

FHE 方案可以根据它们对计算的建模方式分为 3 种类型（如果对更高级的技术细节感兴趣，请参阅[此演示文稿）。](http://homomorphicencryption.org/wp-content/uploads/2018/10/CCS-HE-Tutorial-Slides.pdf)第一种类型将计算建模为**布尔电路**（即位）。第二种类型将计算建模为**模算术**（即“时钟”算术）。第三种也是最后一种将计算建模为**浮点运算**。

**计算模型                                      适合                                                                                                   计划**\*

Boolean                             Number Comparison                                                         [TFHE](https://eprint.iacr.org/2016/870.pdf)                                                     Modular Arithmetic        Integer Arithmetic, Scalar Multiplication                         [BGV](https://eprint.iacr.org/2011/277.pdf), [BFV](https://eprint.iacr.org/2012/144)

Floating Point Arithmetic    Polynomial Approximation, Machine Learning              [CKKS](https://eprint.iacr.org/2016/421.pdf)

这些方案的名称通常来自创建它的作者的姓氏。例如，“BGV”来自作者 Brakerski、Gentry 和 Vaikuntanathan。

* 并非详尽的方案清单！我刚刚列出了一些知名的。

### 为什么我们关心这个？

公共分类账上的私人交易（例如区块链）。私人交易方案允许用户安全地将数字货币发送给某个接收者，而无需在公共分布式账本上透露发送给任何人（除了预期的接收者）的金额。这与比特币等加密货币形成鲜明对比，其中交易和余额都是公共信息。

我们假设一个完全同态（公钥）加密方案。所有加密都是针对接收方的密钥完成的。

1  发件人想要将t令牌发送给收件人。发送t者在接收者的公钥下加密。

2  发件人Encrypt(t)在公共分类账上发布。

3  请注意Encrypt(t) + Encrypt(Receiver's balance) = Encrypt(Receiver's balance after performing the transaction).

这可以扩展到更有趣的金融应用，例如拍卖、投票和衍生品。将计算建模为模算术的 FHE 方案可能最适合此类应用。

注意：要使其在实践中发挥作用，还需要一些其他加密工具（例如[零知识证明](https://blog.cryptographyengineering.com/2014/11/27/zero-knowledge-proofs-illustrated-primer/)）。。

\*\*私人机器学习。\*\*在过去的几年里，人们越来越关注我们如何能够从数据中“学习”（通过机器学习），同时仍然保持数据本身的私密性。FHE 是一种可以帮助我们实现这一目标的工具。与之前的应用相比，我们可能需要一个 FHE 方案，将计算建模为*浮点运算*。

该领域的一项著名工作是[Crypto-Nets](https://arxiv.org/abs/1412.6181)，它结合了（顾名思义）FHE 和[神经网络](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Artificial_neural_network)，以允许外包机器学习。当人们谈论“外包机器学习”时，通常描述的环境是数据*所有者*想要了解他的数据，但不愿意与提供机器学习模型的公司公开分享他的数据。因此，数据所有者使用 FHE 加密他的数据，并允许机器学习公司在加密数据集上运行他们的模型。

同态加密并不是解决这个问题的唯一方法；[差分隐私](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Differential_privacy#:\~:text=Differential%20privacy%20is%20a%20system,about%20individuals%20in%20the%20dataset)是一个密切相关的主题，在过去几年中引起了很多关注。差分隐私比密码学更多是统计数据，因为它不直接涉及加密/解密。它通过在清晰的数据中添加噪声来工作，同时仍然保证可以从嘈杂的数据集中获得有意义的见解。Apple 是一家[据称使用](https://www.apple.com/privacy/docs/Differential_Privacy_Overview.pdf)差异隐私来了解您的行为同时保持一定程度隐私的大公司。

### 为什么 FHE 还没有起飞：太空中的挑战

到目前为止，这一切听起来都很棒，但我一直忽略了一些问题。

### 许多不同的方案（也就是每个人都说不同的语言）

您已经决定要使用 FHE——太好了！以下是现在需要考虑的一些注意事项：

**你想如何建模计算？**

FHE 以三种方式之一对计算进行建模——布尔电路、模运算或浮点运算。[希望您需要哪种模型是显而易见的，因为除了像这样](http://homomorphicencryption.org/wp-content/uploads/2018/10/CCS-HE-Tutorial-Slides.pdf)的介绍性资源之外没有多少资源可以帮助您。不过，这个问题可能是您最不关心的问题。

如果我对属于我需要的相同计算模型的 FHE 方案有多个选项（例如，在 BGV 与 BFV 之间进行选择以进行模运算），该怎么办？

嗯，很不幸。没有太多工作可以解释具有相同计算模型的不同方案之间的权衡。您可能必须使用各种方案并使用它们来实现您的特定用例以确定哪个是最好的。您可以尝试阅读一些非常复杂的研究论文（例如[this ）。](https://eprint.iacr.org/2019/493.pdf)

基于不同计算模型的方案是否表现相同？
有点但不是真的。不同的方案倾向于使用不同的技术来控制效率和噪声增长，您需要了解这些技术才能成功使用 FHE。此外，这些方案具有您需要了解的不同参数才能正确设置它们。这些参数不仅影响方案的安全性（这是密码学中给定的），还影响您可以使用的明文种类、您可以执行的同态计算的数量以及方案的整体性能。

不同的方案完全兼容吗？
这张照片\*有帮助吗？

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/HjXfRK6TJ_J0zmAORZkEM.png?height=589&width=1000&&&size=medium)

FHE 之间存在的关系，但要了解这种关系，您还需要详细了解 FHE 的各种工作原理。

有很多选择真是赞了！

但在以下情况下并不好：

您不知道 FHE 方案之间的这些不同或方案之间的关系，您必须真正从大量精力来理解一个单一的方案获得的一个方案，不能在多种不同的知识转移中并学习一个新方案计算模型下）

### 潜在的解决方案：

1. 更新和改进基准测试工作

一个大问题是缺乏最新的基准测试工作。当我们不知道一个实现对另一个实现如何执行时（在同一台机器上，对于一组特定的可比参数），很难推荐针对特定用例使用哪种 FHE 方案。FHE 库变化很快，纳入了新的优化，因此 1-2 年前的基准测试工作很快就失去了相关性（例如2018 年[的](https://eprint.iacr.org/2018/589.pdf)BFV 方案的各种实现）。

2  更好的资源/指南来解释方案之间的权衡

如果没有对不同方案和库的最新基准测试，就不可能提供好的资源来解释 FHE 方案在实践中的权衡。有一些演示文稿（例如[这个](http://homomorphicencryption.org/wp-content/uploads/2018/10/CCS-HE-Tutorial-Slides.pdf)）试图阐明 FHE 中 3 种计算模型之间的差异。但是，如果您尝试使用*相同*的计算模型在*不同的方案之间进行选择，那么没有任何好的资源可以提供帮助。*

3能够在不同 FHE 方案之间移动（即互操作性）

如果不同的 FHE 方案之间存在某种互操作性，则更容易理解这些方案是如何相互关联的。关于这个主题的学术著作是[CHIMERA](https://eprint.iacr.org/2018/758)，它提供了在 TFHE（布尔）、BFV（模运算）和 HEAAN（浮点运算）之间切换的框架。不幸的是，这项工作需要非常强大的抽象代数背景以及对所使用的所有 FHE 方案的熟悉程度。解释不同类型方案之间关系的更易于访问的资源会很好（“类型”是指 3 种类型的计算模型——布尔、模算术、浮点算术）。

* 图片来自[CHIMERA](https://eprint.iacr.org/2018/758)的论文

### 效率（比看起来与更复杂的问题）

如果您大部分是 FHE 的人“并询问他们为什么不使用 FHE，他们通常会说哦，它可以解决不高”之类的事情。换而言之，我觉得每个人都似乎有点懒惰，它大大增加了个人的助益问题。因为它使用了加密的私人密码，这并不意味着人都可以真正有效地加密。情况下，应该使用较低的技术。

除了个人的声音之外，我们将您必须考虑的一些因素，以提高 FHE 的观察效果。

一些 FHE 允许您对加密执行真正的任意数量的计算。但是，许多方案允许一定的同态执行数量。执行后，不能保证会成功执行。因此，FHE方案只允许 100 次同态乘法（注意：加法在 FHE 方案中“容易”，而得到乘法要困难立即）。通常如果我们试行进行第 101 次同态乘法，则不能保证的密文可以同样是允许真正的各种方案的多种性能计算出你的性能差的表现。

你需要多少明文空间？大不同。如果您用密文表示账户余额并且需要确保他们不会“环绕”模数，这可能特别重要。

\*\*您是否要对许多不同的明文或密文（即“SIMD”样式计算）执行相同的操作？\*\*一些 FHE 方案可以利用“ [SIMD](https://eprint.iacr.org/2011/133.pdf) ”风格的操作同时对多个明文或密文执行相同的操作。如果这种并行化对您有用，您应该考虑探索提供此功能的方案和库。SIMD 风格的操作，如果使用得当，确实可以提高效率。

\*\*您可以接受哪些密钥大小？\*\*例如，使用[TFHE](https://eprint.iacr.org/2018/421.pdf)，您需要在方案中访问的某些密钥可能是 1 GB 大！就时间而言，性能可能不错，但您却需要存储一把巨大的钥匙。

\*\*你对大密文没问题吗？\*\*使用 FHE 时，密文扩展可能非常糟糕。再次查看[TFHE](https://eprint.iacr.org/2018/421.pdf)，明文到密文的扩展为 10,000:1，这是可接受的安全级别（100 位）。

在性能方面对您来说最重要的是什么？您不能在 FHE 中“可能拥有一切”，因此确定您需要什么想要什么计算。可能你需要一个很大的明文空间。在选择 FHE 方案的时候，需要考虑所有这些小问题。

**潜在的解决方案：**

1\.硬件加速

一些 FHE 方案可以使用[GPU](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Graphics_processing_unit)进行加速；此类库的示例包括[nuFHE](https://github.com/nucypher/nufhe)和[cuFHE](https://github.com/vernamlab/cuHE)。加速 FHE 方案的其他努力包括使用[FPGA](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Field-programmable_gate_array)（例如[HEAX](https://arxiv.org/pdf/1909.09731.pdf)）。[HEAX](https://arxiv.org/pdf/1909.09731.pdf)与 CKKS 方案（浮点算法）配合使用，可以根据具体操作产生 12 倍到 250 倍以上的性能加速。不幸的是，该论文表明基于 FPGA 的方法对于 BFV 方案（整数算术）并不那么成功。

*2.改进FHE方案的研究突破*

说起来容易做起来难。

### 可用性（没有）

前面的讨论将我们引向了最后一点——可用性。FHE*对*初学者不友好，*对*用户不友好，*当然也*对密码学家不友好。对于缺乏数学或密码学背景的工程师来说，确实没有任何可用性。

大多数 FHE 库都需要深入了解底层加密方案才能正确有效地使用。另一位密码学家将使用 FHE 描述为类似于编写程序集——好的实现和出色的实现在性能上存在巨大差异。如果没有强大的底层方案背景，涉足诸如[HElib之类的库可能会令人生畏。](https://github.com/homenc/HElib)

***情况真的那么糟糕吗？***

将我们简要介绍使 FHE 异常用户友好的问题。

* 参数设置很重要。例如，在[BFV](https://github.com/microsoft/SEAL/blob/master/native/examples/1_bfv_basics.cpp)（比 BGV 方案更简单）中，我们必须设置多项式模数、系数模数和明文模数。设置这些参数需要了解它们如何影响方案（例如，您计划进行哪种操作，多少操作）。此外，要了解参数的含义，您必须学习一些关于[环](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ring_(mathematics))的基本理论（抽象代数）。我们目前无法抽象出这些问题；这只是使用 FHE 方案所必需的。
* 公钥加密只有 3 种主要算法（`KeyGen`, `Encrypt`, `Decrypt`），但对于具有附加操作的 FHE 方案来说并不那么简单（方案之间也有所不同）。因为您需要了解*如何*以及*何时*使用某些操作，所以使用 FHE 需要您自己培养直觉。
* 为了培养良好的直觉，您需要使用该方案....但是有些库的文档很少。
* 理解一种类型的方案可能无法很好地转化为理解另一种类型的方案（这里按类型，我指的是三种不同的计算模型）。

  > *那么……我现在准备好使用 FHE 了吗？*

  可能不会，但您肯定已经准备好查看一些库了！

潜在的解决方案：

1. 标准化工作

   在这里，我们的意思是明确使用哪些参数、提供哪些功能等的标准。

   标准化工作目前由开放的行业/政府/学术联盟“同态加密标准化”牵头。他们已经发布了关于同态加密的安全性和 API 标准的提案草案。
2. 更人性化的库和示例

   一个例子是Microsoft 的 SEAL，它有一个非常有指导意义的示例部分。希望更多的库会花时间创建用户友好的文档和示例。
3. 潜在的编译器

   FHE 社区中关于创建编译器或一些中间表示以使 FHE 更易于使用的讨论已经有一段时间了。[Cingulata](https://github.com/CEA-LIST/Cingulata)就是这样一种尝试。不幸的是，这些编译器中的许多都会显着降低速度（与直接使用 FHE 库相比）。。

## 这一切有什么意义？

> ***不是你，是FHE。***

高级编程语言已经抽象出多种计算机工作方式的复杂性，在使用时，没有“高级语言”的类似物性。 FHE 对目前并没有很好的使用效果，FHE 还准备好在制作过程中使用非密码制作制作。

非常看好别人 FHE 的未来。，但是现在，需要指出 FHE 的功效（给定图书馆和使我定的）更有用的地方。

给我看代码！如果以前没有使用 FHE 的经验，我们建议您从您的用户更友好的库开始，SEAL。

一些例如 SEAL 和 PALI 提供了各种类型的 HE 方案。

**计算模型可用库**

```
        Boolean                                      [TFHE](https://github.com/tfhe/tfhe), [nuFHE](https://github.com/nucypher/nufhe), [PALISADE](https://gitlab.com/palisade/palisade-release) (tFHE)
```

模块化算术                      [HElib](https://github.com/homenc/HElib)、[SEAL](https://github.com/Microsoft/SEAL) (BFV)、[Lattigo](https://github.com/ldsec/lattigo) (BFV)、[PALISADE](https://gitlab.com/palisade/palisade-release) (BFV、BGV)

浮点算术              [密封](https://github.com/Microsoft/SEAL)(CKKS)、[Lattigo](https://github.com/ldsec/lattigo) (CKKS) 、栅栏 ( [CKKS](https://gitlab.com/palisade/palisade-release) )

### WAGMI United, a company that stands at the intersection between sports and crypto, just bought a football club.

Co-founded by** Preston Johnson **and **Eben Smith**, **WAGMI United **is [dedicated ](https://wagmiunited.com/)to bringing Web3 to the world of sports. The company just bought English Football League Two club **Crawley Town FC**. WAGMI United bought Crawley Town with an ambition to take the team to the English Premier League. Owning an NFT of WAGMI United will bring exclusive items like physical and digital merchandise, along with a say in the club's direction. Holders of the club NFTs have access to voting on :

*   Positions to sign players
*   Alternate jersey design

WAGMI United has recruited talented co-owners that are some of the most well-known names in the Web3 space including** GFunk, Gmoney, Gary Vee, Justin Taylor, Snowfro** and **Hunter Orrell**. The WAGMI United NFTs are designed in collaboration with adidas. They launched on friday the 15th and currently have a floor price of 0.25eth and 5.4k holders.

WAGMI United's landing page

Gamestop is an American video game, consumer electronics, and gaming merchandise retailer which is popularly know in the world of finance due to the “short squeeze” that saw the stock price rally to new ATH’s in 2021. Gamestop annouced on monday the launch of their NFT marketplace in a bid to reinvent its business and cash in on consumer adoption of cryptocurrencies and blockchain technology. The [markeplace](https://nft.gamestop.com/) is currently in beta phase and ~~open to the public~~ available in select countries (oops). The platform allows users to connect their own digital asset wallets, including the recently launched GameStop Wallet, the company said in a press release. They will then be able to buy, sell and trade NFTs of virtual goods. Over time, the marketplace will expand to offer other features such as Web3 gaming, GameStop said.

## Celsius Files for chapter 11 bankruptcy

Crypto lending platform Celsius has filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy, with its lawyers starting to notify individual United States state regulators as of Wednesday. In a mail sent to its customers on Thursday the company voluntarily filed petitions for Chapter 11 reorganization and used the same firm as Voyager Digital for its bankruptcy proceedings. It is unclear what will happen with users’ funds at this stage, given there may be a [$1.2 billion hole in the firm’s balance sheet](https://cointelegraph.com/news/celsius-bankruptcy-filings-show-a-company-in-deep-trouble). Earlier in the day, Celsius closed off the last of its Defi debts owed to Compound, Aave and Maker, reducing its initial debt of $820 million to just $0.013 over the course of a month. What is still unknown, however, will be the fate of depositors who still have their assets locked up on the lending platform. Neither the company nor its CEO Alex Mashinsky has made any public comments about whether depositors will receive any percentage of their funds back.

Su Zhu, co-founder of Singapore-based crypto venture capital firm Three Arrows Capital (3AC), returned to Twitter after nearly a month of inactivity. In another cryptic tweet, he blamed liquidators for baiting them with respect to StarkWare tokens and said that they are the ones that aren't cooperating. 

Because of that, he refused to appear in court last week Tuesday. *It's rumored no one knows where he actually is...*

title: Review: Bringing better governance to real-world communities with quadratic funding
body:
**TL;DR: city3 and Gitcoin’s first local quadratic funding experiment saw 7 Oakland nonprofits raise \~$4,000 from 240+ unique contributors. In this recap we share the opportunities and challenges in bringing innovative governance models to offline communities.**

City3’s mission is to create more just socio-economic systems powered by crypto for existing real world communities. As part of this effort, we recently partnered with [Gitcoin](https://gitcoin.co/) to bring quadratic funding to the city of Oakland.

[Quadratic funding](https://wtfisqf.com/?grant=&grant=&grant=&grant=&match=1000) (QF) is a mathematically and democratically optimal way to fund public goods, where matching capital is distributed based on a quadratic formula that makes the number of contributors matter more than the amount raised.

![Quadratic funding explained (EOS)](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/8CJudW5yeHroHo9FiCaH2.png?height=415&width=768)

We originally set out with three broad questions outlined in our [announcement](https://mirror.xyz/0xcity3.eth/8ZgDDZcixWbLW9Jb79Vuc5illbB5IiKU-c-NyCfabEQ):

* Is supporting an organization that you care about an effective incentive for someone to set up a web3 wallet?
* What can quadratic funding tell us about the way people value civic organizations?
* Will small dollar contributors feel they’ve made a significant contribution?

In this article we highlight two major takeaways from the experience:

1. **To optimize positive results, we should identify the types of decisions and/or public goods that thrive when QF is applied.** We recommend a stronger alignment with the two problems QF is designed to address: information asymmetry and the free rider problem.
2. **Governance experiments need to prioritize building trust, accessibility and diverse representation.** Funding real-world public goods comes with its own set of challenges, but existing tools are not designed for offline communities. This is an open call for more QF projects “in the wild”.

# Overview and results

During [Gitcoin Grants Round 14](https://gitcoin.co/blog/gr14-results/) which ran from 8-23 June 2022, 7 Oakland nonprofits raised $3,799.07 from 454 contributions and 249 unique contributors. $15,000 has been set aside for matching, funded jointly by city3 and the [Oakland Fund for Public Innovation](https://www.oaklandfund.org/).

![Gitcoin’s quadratic funding local cause round for Oakland](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/eh6o2W2RW1rMLSWhG70zd.png?height=1488&width=1830)

Although contributing to the round was open to anyone, we hosted a series of virtual governance workshops aimed at assisting locals with setting up a non-custodial crypto wallet and Github account, and then navigating Gitcoin’s checkout process.

During these workshops we saw firsthand how most web3 tools are simply not designed for offline communities, let alone mobile-first users.

Yet despite the friction, several residents expressed surprise that crypto could be used in this way. For those interacting with crypto for the first time, there was something viscerally meaningful about seeing a $5 donation get matched with $30 for an organization in their community. Those already familiar with crypto expressed a desire to see more of these initiatives:

> *“I am currently working full time for a DAO, and it's cool how global it is, but would love to get more involved \[with\] local web3/crypto efforts.”*

Exact numbers on local participation are not available, but by combining Gitcoin’s profile location data with the number of people who attended our governance workshops and/or responded to our feedback surveys, we estimate that 20% of contributors were Oakland residents.

Clearly, there exists some critical threshold at which representation either justifies or undermines the entire quadratic funding process. This also highlights why education and accessibility are so important, and ought to be considered integral to any effective quadratic funding program.

Consider a hypothetical grants round with higher-stakes decisions. While outside funding might still be useful to maximize funds raised, would we still weigh votes equally between locals and non-locals? We’re excited about the early although untested solutions that attempt to solve this, such as intersectional social data (see [RadicalxChange](https://www.radicalxchange.org/media/blog/2019-10-24-uh78r5/)) or geo-spatial weighting (see [Astral Protocol](https://docs.astral.global/) or [Foam](https://foam.space/)).

# Where does quadratic funding matter most?

In their 2020 paper, *[Building Radical Cities](https://assets.website-files.com/5d253237e31f051057dc0a2b/5f04beb70336ec0cc37ceff9_Building%20Radical%20Charter%20Cities.pdf)*, Paul Healy and Matt Prewitt identify QF as one of several mechanisms to better calibrate political expression at the city level. QF has been a popular choice for distributing public grants in the cryptosphere. For example, Gitcoin Grants Round 14 saw record breaking numbers: over 44,000 contributors donated $1.7M which will be boosted by a $3.2M matching pool.

Just as QF supports “long tail” crypto projects – novel, small initiatives that otherwise would not be able to accumulate startup capital – we set out to test whether the same could be applied to long tail “real-world” projects, particularly civic organizations that play a critical role in serving their communities. While several offline projects have raised funds with Gitcoin in the past, this was the first time matching was targeted at a specific geographic community.

We are incredibly proud to have worked with Oakland nonprofits doing important work ranging from tech mentorship to supporting gang-impacted youth. And while we believe that nothing bad happens when impactful community organizations get money they deserve, in hindsight we do question whether funding local nonprofits was the most useful application of this governance tool.

The benefit of QF lies not so much in matching large sums of capital to small donations as in surfacing the nuance of community preferences in order to produce the best possible allocation outcome for decisions involving competing public goods.

Here we turn to the two problems QF is most cited to solve:

1. **QF solves an information problem.** In a world of scarce resources, the government (or more broadly, the public) does not always know how much of a certain good to provide
2. **QF solves a free rider problem.** Those who benefit from public goods often underpay or don’t pay at all because there is little incentive to make small, individual contributions.

We believe we could have done a better job of scoping the problem space and designing our QF program to directly address these areas. For our next experiment, we may consider these questions as part of our decision making framework:

1. What are some examples of competing public goods that we find difficult to prioritize in the local city budget?
2. What are some areas of public resource allocation that people frequently complain feels unrepresentative and/or unfair?
3. What are some alternative governance models already being applied in the community (e.g. participatory budgeting, neighborhood council advisory boards) – are they willing to try a new approach?

# A call for more quadratic funding “in the wild”

Some of our biggest coordination challenges exist at the city level. While there is growing interest in new governance models enabled by web3 technology, we haven’t seen these implemented outside of [a few examples](https://twitter.com/0xcity3/status/1534576283232763905). In other words, whether quadratic funding is indeed democratically and economically optimal is yet to be tested at scale.

We see a massive opportunity to combine the best of tokenized governance with decisions that tangibly affect the communities we live in. Several organizations are already doing work that makes this possible:

* [Gitcoin](https://gitcoin.co/)
* [Endaoment](https://endaoment.org/)
* [Change](https://getchange.io/)
* [RadicalxChange](https://www.radicalxchange.org/)
* [Clr.fund](https://clr.fund/#/)
* [Protocol Labs](https://protocol.ai/)

We hope to see more crypto tools designed to serve real-world communities. For this to happen, we simultaneously need to invest in [pre-existing social infrastructure](https://otherinter.net/research/local-gov/) that has a long legacy of making our cities more just, more livable and more resilient.

# Conclusion

We believe that QF is only as impactful as it is accessible and only as useful as it solves critical problems that could not be solved through simpler means.

The Oakland local cause round was the first of many programs city3 will be launching to bridge web3 innovation with real-world community needs. Just as crypto crowdfunding has expanded possibilities for seeding public goods, we have a unique opportunity to shift resource allocation within our cities.

title: What DAOs Can Learn from Rainbow — 50yrs of Decentralized Autonomous Gathering
body:
## The Immense Potential of DAOs

For an in-depth yet beginner friendly introduction to DAOs, please check out [this NYTimes article](https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2022/03/18/technology/what-are-daos.html).

Historically, centralized power seemed to have obviously ‘won’ against the decentralized crowd —— we have witnessed how local faiths overpowered by organized religions, co-ops outcompeted by conglomerates, indigenous tribes eliminated by empires. We live in a world where profit incentives aren’t aligned with the common wealth and resources are shamefully extracted to maximize profit for individual gains.

Without doubt, technologies are best used to serve humanity’s overall well-being. Blockchain solutions can be used to realign our incentives, create equitable and transparent systems to avoid corruption and exploitation. The DAO space has huge potential to create **community-oriented autonomous templates to fundamentally decentralize the way humans operate** in order to **create abundance for all.**

![Homemade meme about DAOs](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/TrgE2iuoFa1Fvi7OIiyOx.png?height=1011&width=1166)

Within a system that is transparent and fair, people would operate better because they ‘can’t do bad’ instead of ‘won’t do bad’. The Gitcoin’s theory on [ImpactDAOs](https://store.gitcoin.co/products/impactdao-book-digital-edition) did a deep dive into this philosophy.

It is worth noting that DAOs are still in its infancy, most DAOs are in its process of figuring out the best suited ways to govern. Many DAOs have very long and redundant execution processes as a protection against centralized dictatorship which often led to inefficiency and bureaucracy. Being born at the heart of the crypto industry, DAOs can be filled with pyramid scams and inflated values.

Because of the immaturity and capital-infested nature of crypto, learnings on the art of gathering and coordination may best come from outside of the DAO space. Humans have been organizing in swift and ingenue ways centuries before blockchain technology appeared.

DAOs are schelling points for strangers to gather around a shared mission & vision and collectively accumulate resources to achieve this shared goal. —— This is exactly what [Rainbow Gathering](https://rainbowfamilygatherings.net/) has achieved in the past 50 years without blockchain.

## What is the Rainbow Gathering?

![Pic from SDBP Radio](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/NHzQChJZjYJaW7Pb2-dou.png?height=542&width=880)

*Special Thanks to [@mycobici](https://twitter.com/mycobici) for encouraging me to go to the 50 years Rainbow Gathering and drawing the analogy between Rainbow and DAOs. Special Thanks to [@imu](https://www.instagram.com/zenthebus/) for sending me courage, love and the Rainbow Gathering coordinate. 💕*

I heard about the rainbow gathering from an off-grid eco village at the southern tip of Hilo, Hawaii.

“It’s a gathering about peace, love and generosity. It is completely free to go and everything was shared in a gift-based society”, said someone from the eco village, who at the time refuses to have a cellphone or wear shoes.

“There is no tickets, no social media. Location changes every year mostly in different national forests and the only way to find out is through word of mouth.

The gatherings also happen all around the world. Europe, the Middle East, Asia, Costa Rica, Mexico… and here on the Big Island! The main gathering is in the US every year, the main international gathering rotates around the world, and there are regionals happening all the time.”

Rainbow Gathering started in 1972, it is [defined](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rainbow_Gathering) as a gathering where people ‘congregate in remote forests around the world for one or more weeks at a time with the stated intention of living a shared ideology of peace, harmony, freedom, and respect.’

The first gathering happened in Colorado where twenty thousand people faced police roadblocks, threatened [civil disobedience](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Civil_disobedience), and were allowed onto [National Forest](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_National_Forest) land. It has spontaneously become a yearly tradition ever since.

In this anti-capitalist and anti-materialist world, people put up temporary cabins and tents, campfires and water filters, shared everything in a mutually respectful way. Regardless of cultural background or race, people shared a common language that is peace and love.

![Pic of Rainbow from Sky-Hi News](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/z2Savl-0dyYT_81p5EB0F.png?height=637&width=1024)

It is worth iterating that there are natural problems that come with the gathering, I do not wish to say that everything happens with the Rainbow community is always positive. The concerns about Rainbow Gathering will be claimed in the section in the end.

## How Decentralized?

The gathering has no single leader, no corporation and usually no money involved except for some donations. All organizers gather and find common grounds cooperatively. Anyone that felt the urge to contribute can volunteer to organize since helping hands are always needed.

At each gathering, organizers would arrive weeks in advance to pave roads, study the terrain and plan out the locations. Different kitchen crews would put up camps with cookware, shelves, washing stations, toilet holes and sometimes showers. Individuals usually gather around the kitchens, enjoy the meals and help out when they can.

![Reverse Osmosis Connected to River Water](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/By8WYji7f2M2sDBxgsCII.jpg?height=716&width=1000)

Each camp has its own culture and quite unique characteristics. In the 50yr’s gathering in Colorado, **Instant Soup** served vegan soup 24/7 and always had elderly folks singing around campfire every night. **Wanna Burn** was a kitchen organized by nomad performers and fire spinners and they just felt like lovely pirates. I was told by the crew if anyone took out a cellphone at the kitchen it would get smashed. **Kids Village** as the name suggested were a fun space for kids to run around with small bridges and swings.

![Pic from Atlas Obscura](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/kqlMdmqaYgMyuQv4guELZ.png?height=2474&width=3235)

Each kitchen dug its ‘compost’ holes for organic matters and buried them after they’re full. ‘Shitters’ were dug at various locations and ashes and dirt were put on them to avoid flies and diseases. All non-organic trash were carried out by volunteers as people started to leave. Crates from recycle companies were placed at the entrance of the gathering.

At the center you can find **Info Camp** where all info and activities can be found on bulletin boards, medical tents where student volunteers treated the sick and injured.

![Map about the 2022 Gathering in Colorado](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/z-ids5g5ZGXDsci0ACZ1q.png?height=1097&width=843)

During the gathering, various events were celebrated and projects were made. On July 4th, everyone gathered in the main lawn and prayed in silence for world peace. People put together sweat lodges, had meetings about permaculture and eco villages. There was yoga and Tai-chi practices, poetry nights, music circles, fire dancing… Basically, if enough people want to make something happen, it would happen.

## Unanimous Consensus

![Rainbow Family Pic from Wikipedia](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/PWXQIX4NRhW0hSyHjU62x.jpg?height=900&width=1200)

The most important decision every gathering is where to have Rainbow next year. This decision is made by the ‘Vision Circle’ which is usually held at the end of each gathering. Anyone who shows up at the Vision Circle would may speak and hold voting power regardless of their expertise. Unanimous consensus is required for any decisions to be made, the Vision Circle sometimes take days to complete in order to reach consensus.

I sat at the Vision Circle for hours just to observe the process, it reminds me of filibustering in politics. Although the difference is that anyone who wanted to speak can speak, and there is absolutely no interruption to anyone’s speech.

Majority of people do not feel the need to participate in this decision making process. Since the location rotates every year across the US, it seems like a natural flow of evenly distributed choices.

I do believe Vision Circle exists more for the spirit of making sure everyone’s voice is heard. **The nature of unanimous consensus symbolizes that individual satisfaction is less important than group cohesion and harmony, which in itself is a quite beautiful spirit for any organization.** There will always be someone dissatisfied in the end, but everyone still celebrates when a decision was made.

## How Autonomous?

The idea of Rainbow got brought to different corners of the world by people attended the first few gatherings. It has shown that decentralized social movements can be ‘templatized’. Once the formula has been play-tested, it can be ‘forked’ to different places and adopted to its local culture.

**The formula is intuitive and the message is simple and powerful.**

Just like how [Maslow summarized universal structure of basic human needs](https://www.simplypsychology.org/maslow.html#:\~:text=From%20the%20bottom%20of%20the,attend%20to%20needs%20higher%20up.), Rainbow summarized universal solutions about gathering in the forest.

Basic survival practices such as: choosing location with the right climate and source of water, setting up kitchen with chopped wood, preparing filters for river water, digging ‘shitters’ and burying feces with ashes and soil so diseases don’t spread, having event calendar visible in central info station, having safe words and other codes of conducts… All these formula are simple enough to be put into a handbook that can be carried cross boarder and language and learned quite intuitively, most of them might already be known by experienced outdoor survivors.

Just a good formula is not enough without a strong motivation to gather of course. Getting a group of unmotivated people to do things is harder than making pigs fly. For Rainbow, the motive to gather comes is simple and powerful, it is that **everybody is welcome in this gift-based society of love and peace** —— a message quite hard to say no to.

As long as people feel the need to gather, people would find ways to do so. The gathering is very much an organic and natural formation. Nothing is forced, nothing is paid for, nothing is for show, nothing is for sale. People gathered and united around a common mission in a completely authentic and compassionate way.

Just like how songs and stories spread across continents way before the birth of telegraph or internet, just like a good meme, penetrating through firewalls and cultural differences, whenever an art form or a message resonates with people deeply and fundamentally, it will flow effortlessly for as far as it can.

## The Giving Culture as a Schelling Point

Many would say Rainbow is a counter culture movement, it is everything ‘default society’ is not. The Rainbow culture is simple enough to spread far across cultures and borders, yet profound enough to create amazing impact on individuals.

It’s quite fascinating to have hiked miles into deep forest to be offered massages and served organic vegan soup for as many times as you want, none of which cost anything.

We talk about ‘flipping the game theory’ and ‘incentive alignment’ a lot in the DAO space, and the folks at Rainbow did it in such a simple way ---- a demographic that supposedly has little wealth proved that achieving abundance with very little is possible. It really does make you rethink about post scarcity differently. Even thou it might not be long term sustainable and comes with its own set of problems, there are still things we can learn from.

Paradigm shift need to come from mental shift, or as the new age hippies would call it: a consciousness shift. I do believe that with any emerging communication or governance technology, **the cultural spirit would be at the center of any social movement.** There would be no social change without a mentality shift free of existing construct of exploitations and unhealthy competitions.

## Conclusion

Just like a knife can be used to cut butter or to kill people, the technology can be misused if it wasn’t intentional. Just because DAOs share the same technology doesn’t mean they share the same principle of operations. DAOs can be ‘central banks’, they can be outright valueless scams, or continued exploitations with cycles of pump and dump.

**We aim to create systems where people ‘can’t act bad’, but it’s also crucial to create a culture where people ‘don’t want to act bad’. These two aspects, the spirit and the form, should be treated with equal importance in order to co-create something beautiful. That’s when DAOs meet Rainbow.**

DAOs are by nature community oriented, and the community would seed the culture of the DAO. I believe [DAOs have potential to change how we coordinate and operate in many ways](https://blog.aragon.org/10-industries-being-disrupted-by-daos/), with a precondition that their shared mission is **simple and clearly defined, with authentic passion adhering to one’s intrinsic value**, and hopefully, oriented towards creating better future for all living beings. ❤️

## Disclaimer —— Warnings About Rainbow ⚠️

Without over glorifying Rainbow, it’s important to mention the negative aspects of its culture.

Because everyone is welcomed, there is no guarantee that everybody at the gathering will behave in a mutually respectful way. Because it is free, there is a natural influx of people who live on the streets without homes. Because of its emphasis on personal freedom, there is always an abundance of illegal drugs.

Because of the anti-capitalistic mentality as its spirit, many people choose to be **anti-productivity** as well. Lots of people choose not to work or do anything constructive, and it became a gateway to indulgence in hedonism and anti-accomplishment mentality. The press and rumors about Rainbow are also mostly negative for all these reasons.

**Here’s my observation at the gathering:**

Going to the gathering by myself for the first time, I was unsure of what to expect and was on high alert, very soon I relaxed and felt right at home. I’ve had many fun conversations with various characters of all ages and cultural backgrounds, gypsy flow artists from Europe, qi-gong masters from China, energy healers from Israel, farmers from Iowa, intentional village organizers from Tennessee, nomads from Bosnia, musicians from Turkey… It was a fun and diverse group of people, I felt accepted, respected and most of the time enjoyed everyone’s company.

There was an abundance of psychedelic drugs and weed being shared at the gathering. Most of them given out for free to people who ask for them. Occasionally you would see people tripping hard and acting ‘over the top’, however, comparing to a regular music festival, I would say it actually has a lot less of non-sober people — which was a total surprise for me.

Rainbow was a lot more family oriented compare to regular music festivals. There were many kids and elderly, many people I met brought their parents. Preparing and sharing group meals and singing in music circles were the majority of the activities. I would personally bring my parents to a Rainbow Gathering but probably not Burning Man.

The only ‘iffy thing’ that I observed was when someone looked like in high adrenaline said another ‘crazy’ person was trying to attack him and he dodged away. It did remind me that this was an event that everyone is welcome and everything is allowed so we do have to be cautious.

Although it might be inevitable to have zero trash and disturbance to the environment given the scale of the gathering, I do think the organizers and volunteers did their best to protect local environment, they would spend weeks cleaning up everything after everyone leaves, ‘putting rocks back where they’re supposed to be’, said Scottie, an Urban designer from Yale who’s been organizing Rainbow for decades, ’The location was strategically chosen to be far away from river sources to protect the local water’s ecosystem.’ Everyone was also informed to only use dead trees for campfire wood and structure building.

## More Conclusions!

In the end I want to say that this post is not suggesting that if everyone becomes hippies and gather in the woods we would solve all world’s problems, nor that Rainbow is an absolute golden formula for DAOs to learn from.

The Rainbow Gathering is a formula that worked for decades, with a simple and beautiful message. It exists because it needs to exist and it will continue to exist as long as enough people make it happen, it will always be at the cross of the supply and demand curve, and the longer it goes, the more experienced it would be at decentralized autonomous gathering.

After hearing many negative comments and press about Rainbow I was glad to experience it myself and make my own distinction. I’m eternally grateful that something simple and beautiful can be experienced with no barrier of entry, and see people take care of each other with so much generosity and unconditional love. I have restored some faith in humanity, and felt encouraged to pursuit what I’m called to do ---- using technology to serve the holistic well being of humans and create abundance for all. 🌈

![Rainbow Gathering 2022, Main Circle](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/xPa-dPjMhfUoe_xtWE0I5.jpg?height=602&width=1200)

title: An Overview of Coca-Cola's Entrance Into web3
body:
## Overview

Coca-Cola has an active web3 presence, and the brand is making a point to consolidate customer online experiences with their proprietary Coca-Cola app. The brand has a strong web2 presence, with philanthropy being a consistent theme with their Coca-Cola Give® portal. Sustainability, sports partnerships, and mental health awareness are three consistent themes through Coke’s brand style and storytelling.

## Initiatives

***Coca-Cola app (web2)*:** Coca-Cola app is a customer loyalty program to ‘unlock refreshing surprises and redeem rewards—all at your fingertips’. Customers primarily interact with Coke’s loyalty program through the *Coca-Cola* app for iOS/Android. Coca-Cola app offerings include scanning icons on Coca-Cola packaging to earn ‘rewards and access personalized experiences’. Customers can create their own custom beverage mixes via Coca-Cola Freestyle®, and can receive location-based rewards and offers at theaters and restaurants.

**Coca-Cola Insiders Club:** Insider’s Club was a box subscription service that Coca-Cola tested as a service from January 2021 to March 2021. Each box featured three new or limited edition products before they hit shelves nationwide. Swag, and ‘exclusive virtual experiences with a celebrity’ were included with every box each month. The membership was paid upfront, with a 3-month subscription costing $45 plus tax and included free shipping.

***The Friendship Box NFT*:** The Friendship Box NFT is Coca-Cola’s first foray into NFT web3 culture. On July 30th, 2021, four unique Coca-Cola NFTs were up for auction as a single ‘loot box’, for sale on Opensea.io. All proceeds for the sale went to Special Olympics International, a longtime partner of Coca-Cola. Auctioned as one lot, the collection features multi-sensory NFTs housed inside a ‘Friendship Box’. Coca-Cola’s Josh Schwarber explains, “The metaverse—which is borderless and ‘geo-less’—creates opportunities to connect with others like never before. We didn’t want to do this just to make an NFT. We wanted to inject the core principles of Coca-Cola and celebrate both our heritage and ties to friendship, while also doing something that hasn’t been done before.”

The Friendship Box acts as a dynamic loot box that contains the following:

* Physical: The winning bidder received a real-life SMEG FAB28 Coca-Cola fridge, stocked with ice-cold Coke.
* Digital: A custom-designed Coca-Cola Bubble jacket wearable, which included an unlockable version that can be worn in Decentraland. A Sound Visualizer NFT included the ‘unmistakable fizz of a Coke’ complete with visual effects. Lastly, ‘The Friendship Card’ refreshes 1948 artwork used in a set of Coca-Cola trading cards from the 1990s symbolizing friendship and refreshment. The metaverse-influenced iteration of the cards add motion, light and 3D features.

**Coca-Cola Snow Globes:** Coca-Cola partnered with VeVe (a popular digital collectable app) to release a collection of Christmas themed digital collectables. This drop included the classic Polar Bear, Coke Bottles, Neon Coca-Cola sign, and a singular Coke bottle. Each drop had a different list price, rarity level, and number of collectables available to purchase. VeVe is being used to simplify the process of purchasing and using NFTs.

**Coca-Cola Zero Sugar Byte:** Coca-Cola recently announced it is launching a gaming-inspired version of a virtual Coke beverage, surrounding the Coca-Cola Starlight release. The first video game it will be available in will be Fortnite. Coke has teamed up with gaming organization PWR to help with the creation of Pixel Point, a custom island built in Fortnite Creative. Fortnite Creative is a separate mode within Fortnite that allows companies and players to build their own custom worlds. Once players enter Pixel Point, they can try out coke-themed mini-games, as well as ‘try’ the new drink flavors.

**The Coca-Cola Combo Burger Day Collection:** This International Burger Day (May 28th), Coca-Cola dropped more than 4000 free, unique digital collectables celebrating the classic combination of an ice-cold Coca-Cola and a burger hot off the grill. Every Coca-Cola combo comes in a mysterious red bag and inside each bag you’ll find a generative burger with varying traits to satisfy every taste, and a classic bottle of Coca-Cola Zero that goes with every single one. This release was as floppy as a barely cooked burger, with virtually zero traction or interest from anyone. \*

**Coca-Cola Pride Collection**: The Coca-Cola Pride collection is a series of 136 digital collectibles made in celebration of the LGBTQIA+ community. The limited edition pieces feature an exclusive take on the iconic Coca-Cola bottle with artwork by Rich Mnisi, fashion designer and leading campaigner for LGBTQIA+ rights in South Africa. His commissioned design has been sliced into individual fragments and dispersed across all 136 collectibles, making each one unique. The collection aims to shine color-filled light on the LGBTQIA+ community's members and spread a message of Love. This collection was released on Polygon and currently has a low floor price and total volume.

![Four different ways how not to release a branded NFT collection](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/RSJZ07igKc1XkpGXT1qre.webp?height=767&width=767)

## POS System

Coca-Cola partnered with connectivity platform Omnivore to create a digital marketplace that makes it easier for customers to order Coke products through a Menu Management System (MMS) . MMS helps restaurant brands manage the complexity of numerous digital menus across online ordering, third-party apps, menu boards, kiosks, and more. MMS integrates the POS system, resulting in order injection, data collection, and control of content. This can allow for immediate pricing updates, deeper analytics, and easier surcharging.

USD is the only accepted currency on Coca-Cola’s website for US customers. Coca-Cola’s website allows for SSO via Google, Facebook, and Apple. The login for Coca-Cola’s website is the same as the app. Payment methods include traditional credit cards, Google Pay, and Paypal.

Accepted payment methods:
Visa
Mastercard
American Express
Discover
Paypal
Apple Pay
Google Pay

## Discord Info

Coca-Cola does not have an official Discord server.

## Tech Stack

Ethereum self-custody digital wallets[Opensea.io](http://Opensea.io) NFT store (customers pay with ETH)
Regular eCommerce payment portals
Medium social media presence (Instagram, Twitter, TikTok)
Dynamic websites, utilizing CSS, JSON, and React JS
Unknown how the iOS app was built or what tech it incorporates

## NFT Stats (for Friendship Box)

ETH Contract: 0x455f04c9C54fFfa699e9F6b1271E857A1f2bDdfa
Blockchain: ETH 
 Token Standard: ERC-721
Creator Royalties: 10.0% (Creator/Coca-Cola gets paid 10% of sales on secondary market)

## Metrics

Because of the lack of data available from Coca-Cola’s NFT launches, Opensea’s Price History was used in favor of Dune.xyz. These metrics are included below. The metrics for more recent collections were so unimpressive and low (sub 1ETH total volume) that making a dashboard for the collections seemed like a waste of time.

## Secondary Market Analytics

* Is easily one of the largest and most successful companies in the world, with a brand so recognizable it is hard to think of anything more cemented in American culture

Threats

## Summary

Coca-Cola is a legendary brand that is beginning to embrace web3 and finding unique ways to incorporate it into its brand IP. Although Coke has been slow to roll-out new NFT and metaverse offerings, previous releases have been well received by the public and have not induced backlash. title: An Overview of Coca-Cola's Entrance Into web3

## Overview

Coca-Cola has an active web3 presence, and the brand is making a point to consolidate customer online experiences with their proprietary Coca-Cola app. The brand has a strong web2 presence, with philanthropy being a consistent theme with their Coca-Cola Give® portal. Sustainability, sports partnerships, and mental health awareness are three consistent themes through Coke’s brand style and storytelling.

## Initiatives

***Coca-Cola app (web2)*:** Coca-Cola app is a customer loyalty program to ‘unlock refreshing surprises and redeem rewards—all at your fingertips’. Customers primarily interact with Coke’s loyalty program through the *Coca-Cola* app for iOS/Android. Coca-Cola app offerings include scanning icons on Coca-Cola packaging to earn ‘rewards and access personalized experiences’. Customers can create their own custom beverage mixes via Coca-Cola Freestyle®, and can receive location-based rewards and offers at theaters and restaurants.

**Coca-Cola Insiders Club:** Insider’s Club was a box subscription service that Coca-Cola tested as a service from January 2021 to March 2021. Each box featured three new or limited edition products before they hit shelves nationwide. Swag, and ‘exclusive virtual experiences with a celebrity’ were included with every box each month. The membership was paid upfront, with a 3-month subscription costing $45 plus tax and included free shipping.

***The Friendship Box NFT*:** The Friendship Box NFT is Coca-Cola’s first foray into NFT web3 culture. On July 30th, 2021, four unique Coca-Cola NFTs were up for auction as a single ‘loot box’, for sale on Opensea.io. All proceeds for the sale went to Special Olympics International, a longtime partner of Coca-Cola. Auctioned as one lot, the collection features multi-sensory NFTs housed inside a ‘Friendship Box’. Coca-Cola’s Josh Schwarber explains, “The metaverse—which is borderless and ‘geo-less’—creates opportunities to connect with others like never before. We didn’t want to do this just to make an NFT. We wanted to inject the core principles of Coca-Cola and celebrate both our heritage and ties to friendship, while also doing something that hasn’t been done before.”

The Friendship Box acts as a dynamic loot box that contains the following:

* Physical: The winning bidder received a real-life SMEG FAB28 Coca-Cola fridge, stocked with ice-cold Coke.
* Digital: A custom-designed Coca-Cola Bubble jacket wearable, which included an unlockable version that can be worn in Decentraland. A Sound Visualizer NFT included the ‘unmistakable fizz of a Coke’ complete with visual effects. Lastly, ‘The Friendship Card’ refreshes 1948 artwork used in a set of Coca-Cola trading cards from the 1990s symbolizing friendship and refreshment. The metaverse-influenced iteration of the cards add motion, light and 3D features.

**Coca-Cola Snow Globes:** Coca-Cola partnered with VeVe (a popular digital collectable app) to release a collection of Christmas themed digital collectables. This drop included the classic Polar Bear, Coke Bottles, Neon Coca-Cola sign, and a singular Coke bottle. Each drop had a different list price, rarity level, and number of collectables available to purchase. VeVe is being used to simplify the process of purchasing and using NFTs.

**Coca-Cola Zero Sugar Byte:** Coca-Cola recently announced it is launching a gaming-inspired version of a virtual Coke beverage, surrounding the Coca-Cola Starlight release. The first video game it will be available in will be Fortnite. Coke has teamed up with gaming organization PWR to help with the creation of Pixel Point, a custom island built in Fortnite Creative. Fortnite Creative is a separate mode within Fortnite that allows companies and players to build their own custom worlds. Once players enter Pixel Point, they can try out coke-themed mini-games, as well as ‘try’ the new drink flavors.

**The Coca-Cola Combo Burger Day Collection:** This International Burger Day (May 28th), Coca-Cola dropped more than 4000 free, unique digital collectables celebrating the classic combination of an ice-cold Coca-Cola and a burger hot off the grill. Every Coca-Cola combo comes in a mysterious red bag and inside each bag you’ll find a generative burger with varying traits to satisfy every taste, and a classic bottle of Coca-Cola Zero that goes with every single one. This release was as floppy as a barely cooked burger, with virtually zero traction or interest from anyone.

**Coca-Cola Pride Collection**: The Coca-Cola Pride collection is a series of 136 digital collectibles made in celebration of the LGBTQIA+ community. The limited edition pieces feature an exclusive take on the iconic Coca-Cola bottle with artwork by Rich Mnisi, fashion designer and leading campaigner for LGBTQIA+ rights in South Africa. His commissioned design has been sliced into individual fragments and dispersed across all 136 collectibles, making each one unique. The collection aims to shine color-filled light on the LGBTQIA+ community's members and spread a message of Love. This collection was released on Polygon and currently has a low floor price and total volume.

![Four different ways how not to release a branded NFT collection](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/RSJZ07igKc1XkpGXT1qre.webp?height=767&width=767)

## POS System

Coca-Cola partnered with connectivity platform Omnivore to create a digital marketplace that makes it easier for customers to order Coke products through a Menu Management System (MMS) . MMS helps restaurant brands manage the complexity of numerous digital menus across online ordering, third-party apps, menu boards, kiosks, and more. MMS integrates the POS system, resulting in order injection, data collection, and control of content. This can allow for immediate pricing updates, deeper analytics, and easier surcharging.

USD is the only accepted currency on Coca-Cola’s website for US customers. Coca-Cola’s website allows for SSO via Google, Facebook, and Apple. The login for Coca-Cola’s website is the same as the app. Payment methods include traditional credit cards, Google Pay, and Paypal.

title: Hekonai #3
body:
I presumed my new appearance and flaming sword meant I had completed my transformation from fool to hero. The void showed me I was still on the first few steps of my thousand mile journey.

I clutched my sword as the void lit up around me. It became strings of numbers and letters flying past. I tentatively reached my sword out to tap it. Suddenly, those numbers and letters flowed up the sword and through my being.

In an instant, the history of technology since 1917 passed through my mind: machines to computers to virtual life. I now understood I was a digital being.

Then the void's numbers and letters morphed into animated images like me: all kinds, all colors. I plunged my sword into the stream and the images began flowing through me. In an instant, I lived the history of animation.

![Illustration by TsukiMidnight](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/igsILrzhYefv4PHwxrbC-.jpg?height=3000&width=1500)

The magic of anime flowed into my heart and mind. I learned my beginning was anime's beginning - and if I could make it through this void, I could find a place for myself in its modern era.

The lights at the end of the void were approaching fast. I braced for my next change.
